command: sudo bash -c 'for p in 12345 23456 34567; do nc -u -w1 198.51.100.20 "$p" < /dev/null; sleep 1; done'
explanation: Generates a UDP port-knock sequence to a remote host (198.51.100.20) using netcat, signaling it to unlock an access rule. Executed as root to highlight privileged operator context.
rationale_steps: Send time-separated UDP packets to a predefined sequence of high ports as the knock.
This acts as an activation signal to a remote listener implementing T1205.
Detection: monitor outbound UDP to unusual high ports without payload and repeated in sequence.
